page.title: 20Gravel extraction, Pevensey
page.content: The beach to the{East of Pevensey Bay has a part in the Duke of Devonshire's plans for an{Eastbourne Marina.}This will provide a safe haven for small craft between Rye and Brighton. The necessary Act of Parliament has now been passed to permit a breach of the sea defences.Work has begun to remove valuable{mineral deposits of {gravel}before a golf-range,as part of the Marina complex,is constructed.The large excavation is being filled with inert waste and rubble.Although the gravel is mostly moved by conveyor belt along the beach,much is transported by lorries on the main road.Some motorists have had windscreens broken by flying stones despite the constant sweeping of the road by the contractors. {By the pupils of West Rise County {Junior School,Langney,Eastbourne.
